title: Emmerdale: Actress Elizabeth Estensen leaving ITV soap after 22 years
description: Elizabeth Estensen, who played landlady Diane Sugden, says it is time to "say goodbye".

title: Gen Z battles to bring back unions, one Starbucks at a time
description: Younger Americans are reviving US labour activism amid stagnant wages and Covid hardship.

title: Canada federal election: The man who could topple Trudeau
description: The new Conservative leader has tied Justin Trudeau in the polls with a pitch to moderate voters.

title: Winning photographers capture Britain's maritime heritage
description: The winning images from this year's Shipwrecked Mariners' Society photography competition.

title: How TikTokers took down a Texas anti-abortion site
description: A draconian abortion ban in Texas has Gen Z fighting its enforcement through hacktivism

title: Education in prison: 'If I can do it, anyone can’
description: Two prisoners describe how their education inside took them on a different path.

title: The big problem of building waste and how to tackle it
description: How better technology and regulation could cut the waste generated by the construction industry.

title: GB News: I became a minority of one, says Andrew Neil
description: The ex-BBC presenter who quit the channel says people can decide themselves if it is too right wing.

title: Sir Clive Sinclair: Tireless inventor ahead of his time
description: The prolific innovator invented the pocket calculator and the ill-fated Sinclair C5 electric car.

title: Emma Raducanu reunited with her parents in Bromley
description: Emma Raducanu is photographed with father Ian after becoming Britain's youngest Grand Slam champion.

title: Sara Pascoe revealed as new Great British Sewing Bee host
description: The comic and writer is taking over from Joe Lycett, who has hosted the last three series.

title: Mother wins court case over Staffordshire landfill site emissions
description: Rebecca Currie says her son's breathing difficulties have been made worse by landfill emissions.

title: Sir Elton John: UK and European tour postponed to 2023 after hip injury
description: The rock star says it "breaks my heart" to postpone, but he is still recovering from a hip injury.

title: Nadhim Zahawi: Iraqi refugee to education secretary
description: Iraqi refugee, Teletubby merchandise salesman, pollster, millionaire - meet the new education secretary.

title: Co-op to start selling groceries on Amazon Prime
description: Shoppers will be able to order Co-op's full range of groceries via Amazon across the UK by Christmas.

title: Covent Garden and St John's Wood to continue al fresco dining
description: Outdoor dining is made permanent in parts of central London but Soho's future remains unclear.

title: Marks & Spencer blames Brexit as it closes 11 French stores
description: Brexit has made it "near impossible" for it to supply fresh and chilled products to France, the retailer says.

title: England move up to third in men's world rankings
description: Gareth Southgate's men climb to third in the Fifa world rankings, equalling their highest ever position.

title: UK power prices soar after key cable hit by blaze
description: British wholesale electricity prices for the following day jumped by 19% to £475 per megawatt hour.

title: Most office workers will never return full-time, survey says
description: Most people do not believe workers will return to the office full-time, according to YouGov research.

title: England to host invitational international women's tournament in 2022
description: England is set to host a new invitational international women's football tournament next year.

title: Aukus: UK, US and Australia launch pact to counter China
description: Beijing says the deal, involving nuclear-powered submarines, undermines regional peace.

title: Aston Martin retain Vettel and Stroll for 2022
description: Sebastian Vettel will continue at Aston Martin for a second season in 2022 alongside Canadian Lance Stroll.

title: French storms: Nine drown in choppy Mediterranean sea
description: Those who drowned in the dangerous conditions were all in their 50s, 60s and 70s.

title: Nottingham Forest sack Hughton after dismal start
description: Nottingham Forest sack boss Chris Hughton after six defeats from seven Championship matches this season.

title: Koepka should withdraw from Ryder Cup if he does not love it - Azinger
description: Former US captain Paul Azinger responds to Brooks Koepka's comments about the Ryder Cup by suggesting he should pull out of the 2021 matches.

title: Afghan refugee: Being caught by Taliban 'was like a scary movie'
description: Refugee Marwa Koofi and her family were captured at Kabul airport

title: The Papers: PM 'wields axe' as he 'lays ground for next election'
description: Thursday's front pages are dominated by Boris Johnson's major reshuffle of his cabinet.

title: Foreign students struggling to pay for UK university
description: The pandemic has made studying in the UK more expensive for some international students

title: The 22-year-old who took on a housing giant and won
description: As a new report claims dilapidated housing can kill, the BBC meets an unlikely champion for tenants.
